classFeatures.name: Spellcasting
entries: An event in your past has left an indelible mark on you, infusing you with arcane magic. This font of magic, unlike that of a Sorcerer, originates from the soul. It fuels your spells and augments soul with additional power.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: At 1st level, you know three cantrips of your choice from the soulborne spell list. You learn an additional soulborne cantrip of your choice at 4th level and another at 10th level.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Soulborne table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these soulborne spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.
For example, if you know the 1st-level spell {@spell burning hands} and have a 1st-level and a 2nd-level spell slot available, you can cast {@spell burning hands} using either slot.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st Level and Higher
entries: You know three 1st-level spells of your choice from the soulborne spell list.

You learn an additional soulborne spell of your choice at each level except 12th, 14th, 16th, 17th, 18th, and 20th. Each of these spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For instance, when you reach 3rd level in this class, you can learn one new spell of 1st or 2nd level.

Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the soulborne spells you know and replace it with another spell from the soulborne spell list, which also must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your soulborne spells, since the power of your magic relies on your ability to project your will into the world. You use your Charisma whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Charisma modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a soulborne spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You have a trinket that is infused with a portion of your soul, which can be used as an Arcane Focus for your spell casting. It should be visible at all times.

classFeatures.name: Anima Economy
entries: With your Arcane prowess growing, your control over your soul grows. While any other person's soul is a singular entity, the Soulborne's soul has grown beyond this constraint. Instead of a single entity, the Soulborne's soul is supplemented by Anima - which are additional fragments of souls that orbit the core entity. These Anima becomes an additional daily resource for the Soulborne.

entries.name: Anima
entries: Starting at 2nd level, your soul's form shifts to being an entity with a force of its own. The core entity of the soulborne's soul develops its own gravitational pull, increasing as you grow in power, that can hold a number of additional soul fragments called Anima.

At 2nd level, your soul has the power to hold four Anima. The maximum amount of Anima available to you increases by two at 6th, 10th, 14th, and 19th level. The table below shows the number of Anima available to you.
Soulborne Sorcerers are able to change the colour of their soul on the magical spectrum, allowing them to tap into spells based on the chosen colour.

Starting at 1st level, you gain master of your soul, allowing you to spend a Bonus Action to switch your soul's colour. Switching your colour allows you to cast the following spells at their listed Anima cost instead of a spell slot.

classFeatures.name: Soulborne Metamorphosis
entries: At 3rd level, you gain a feature granted by your Soulborne Metamorphosis that alters the evolution of your soul. Your choice grants branching paths at 3rd level, and again at 6th, 10th, and 14th level

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeatures.name: Soul Scrying
entries: Your affinity with the Arcane nature of your innate Soulborne abilities, and your ability to quickly and effectively manipulate your own soul, has naturally evolved to being able to read the souls of others.

Starting at 6th level, you gain the Soul Scrying feature. When you have completed 8 uninterrupted hours of Soul Scrying, focusing on a single target within 500ft and maintaining concentration on the spell, you come to know the make-up of their soul. You learn the the essence of its being (class,) strength of its Anima (level,) and the purity of the being (alignment.)

classFeatures.name: Soul Shroud
entries: After Soul Scrying has been fully accomplished, you must spend 24 uninterrupted hours wearing the shroud before you can gain the benefits of it. You can store a number of shrouds equal to 2 + your Charisma modifier.
The table below shows an example of Shrouds and their possible effects. As a new Shroud is acquired, the GM will decide with you what the benefits of that Shroud is.

Starting at 6th level, you have the ability to shroud your soul and alter its make-up to be a perfect match of one that you have previously stored. Spending 1 hour and 25gp worth of materials you can change your Soul Shroud. A Shroud, once equipped, is permanent until you spend an action to wilfully remove or replace it with another. The Shroud you wear persists through unconsciousness and all other effects, but may be dispelled with a high-level Dispel Magic or similar.

entries: At 6th level, you gain a feature granted by your Soulborne Metamorphosis.

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeatures.name: Infuse Anima
entries: Starting at 10th level, when you cast a spell of 1st level or higher you can infuse your spells with the power of your soul. Take a single damage die of the spell being cast, and for each point of Anima used roll an additional die equal to half of the single damage die.
Example, {@spell Guiding Bolt} cast at 2nd level causing {@dice 5d6} damage would gain an additional {@dice 1d3} damage per point of Anima infused.

classFeatures.name: Soulborne Metamorphosis feature
entries: At 10th level, you gain a feature granted by your Soulborne Metamorphosis.

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeatures.name: Soulborne Metamorphosis feature
entries: At 14th level, you gain a feature granted by your Soulborne Metamorphosis.

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeatures.name: Soul Crush
entries: Starting at 17th level, you become a master at reading the souls of your foes in an instant, knowing exactly how to inflict damage to their essence. Target a creature within 60ft and crush their very essence into dust. At the cost of 6 Anima, the targeted creature must make a Constitution check against your Spell Save DC. The creature takes 7d8 + 24 necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. You may only use this ability once per encounter. You cannot empower this ability with additional Anima. This ability does not affect creatures without a living soul, such as Constructs.

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeatures.name: Master Manipulator
entries: At 20th level, you become a force to be reckoned with and a master of manipulating souls. Soul Scrying now takes 1 minute to complete, and Soul Shroud takes 1 hour.

classFeatures.name: Soulborne Metamorphosis feature
entries: At 20th level, you gain a feature granted by your Soulborne Metamorphosis.

subclassFeatures.name: Adaptive Soul
entries: Through external strife and conflict, the Adaptive soulborne has spent their entire life thus far willing themselves to be someone else in an attempt to fit in with their surroundings. A survival trait that, in anyone else, would be simply a useful tool has taken hold within the Soulborne's very core and changed how their abilities evolve and manifest. This type of souleborne does not have complete, willful control over their abilities and are instead rule by emotion.
You also gain the Feature: Adaptive Paths, which adds to your Reactive Soul feature at each level where you gain an Adaptive Soul freature

entries.name: Soul Link
entries: Starting at 3rd level, after spending 10 minutes of casting you link souls with another willing creature. This enables the reactionary feature: Reactive Soul.

entries.name: Reactive Soul
entries: A side effect of the Adaptive Soul is the sway of emotions that dictate their very being. Their abilities come from emotional stimuli more often than their willful intent.

Starting at 3rd level, when the creature with which you share the Soul Link is attacked and before the GM declares the results of the attack roll, your emotional response manifests into missiles of Arcane energy.
This feature may only happen if you have not already used a Reaction this round, and can only occur once per round when the first attack roll is made.

subclassFeatures.name: Adaptive Paths
entries: The nature of the Adaptive Soul is the influence that external factors play on their emotions, and their emotional state dictating the evolution of their Soulborne Metamorphosis.

At 3rd, 6th, 10th, and 14th level, you gain the Threshold, Temptation, Transformation, and Atonement Paths respectively. The Adaptive soulborne's path is determined by the emotional stimuli that have affected them most profoundly throughout their life.

entries.name: Ruling Emotions
entries: The Ruling Emotion should be based on the character's roleplay and the most impactful, prominent, or present emotional state of the Adaptive soulborne's current milestone.

Example: at 3rd level, when the Paths first emerge, the backstory of the character and all the events in the first three levels of the Adaptive soulborne's journey thus far will inform the decision. Between 3rd level and 6th level, only the events of the campaign between those milestones should be taken into account unless the GM and player agree otherwise.
This decision should always be made between the Soulborne player and the GM with agreements on both sides.

entries.name: Threshhold Paths
entries: Starting their journeys, the soulborne will cross the threshold between their past life and their new life of adventuring. Thus the Threshold path sets them on their forward trajectory in life.

entries.name: Temptation Paths
entries: As power grows, so does the temptation to abuse that power.

entries.name: Transformation Paths
entries: For better or worse, the soulborne's power is manifesting into its own. With the ability to Infuse Anima comes the ability to transform their power. The Transformation step is one that will define them.

entries.name: Atonement Paths
entries: For the good you may have done, there will be regret and sins to attone. The final stage of the soulborne's journey is one of righting wrongs no matter how small they may seem.

entries.name: Final Confluence
entries: At 20th level, when Reactive Soul is triggered, all four of the effects from each path that has been taken occur simultaneously.

spell.name: Soul Sacrifice
entries: You sacrifice Anima to restore a creature your touch. They regaing hit points equal to {@dice 1d8} + your spellcasting modifier. This spell has no effect on undead, constructs, or any other creature devoid of a soul.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Empowered Soul Sacrifice
entries: By channeling more Anima into this spell, you can empower the healing received by the traget creature. The healing increases by {@scaledice 1d8|1-9|1d6} per additional Anima spent.

spell.name: Soothing Spirit
entries: You sacrifice Anima to restore a creature within range. They regaing hit points equal to {@dice 1d4} + your spellcasting modifier. This spell has no effect on undead, constructs, or any other creature devoid of a soul.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Empowered Soul Sacrifice
entries: By channeling more Anima into this spell, you can empower the healing received by the traget creature. The healing increases by {@scaledice 1d4|1-9|2} per additional Anima spent.
